thread.title: Vero Beach's Pirate Festival is this weekend
thread.title_full: Vero Beach's Pirate Festival is this weekend | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Mary Thurwachter
title: Vero Beach's Pirate Festival is this weekend
text:
Pirates are about to invade Vero Beach — again. But this time, it’ll be in all good fun at Vero Beach Pirate Festival, Friday through Sunday.
Pirates first invaded the east coast in 1715, when a fleet of Spanish ships, loaded with treasure, sailed into the path of a hurricane. The fleet and treasure were all lost at sea.
The festival will include historical re-enactments, costume contests, interactive games, vendors, music and Mermaid Mia. Contributed This year, on the 300th anniversary of the fateful voyage, pirates and treasure hunters and all around fun seekers will meet up in Vero Beach to commemorate loss of the 1715 treasure-filled ships.
The festival, hosted by Pirates of the Treasure Coast and the Vero Beach Chamber of Commerce and held beneath the shade of 300-year-old oak trees in Riverside Park, will include historical re-enactments, costume contests, interactive games, vendors, mermaids, music and other entertainment for all ages.
Hours are from 2 p.m. to 8 p.m. on Friday, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. on Saturday, and 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. on Sunday. Admission is free, although donations are appreciated. Some of the proceeds of the event will go toward the Save the Indian River Lagoon Estuary Now charity and the Indian River County Veterans Council.
Like pirates? You’ll see many of them this weekend at Vero Beach’s Pirate Festival in Riverside Park. Contributed A Pirate’s Ball (for adults) will be from 8 to 10 p.m. Friday in the entertainment tent at Riverside Park. Tickets are $10.
For more information, visit www.verobeachpiratefest.com .
IF YOU GO
Vero Beach Pirate Fest
When: Friday-Sunday
Where: Riverside Park, 3258 Riverside Park Drive, Vero Beach
Cost: Free
Info: www.verobeachpiratefest.com
</p
